motion_h.help2Txt: The motion detection feature generates an alarm whenever movement occurs in the image.
motion_h.help3Txt: Motion is detected in defined Include windows, which are placed in the video image to target specific areas. Movement in the areas outside the Include windows will be ignored. If part of an Include window needs to be masked, this can be configured in an Exclude window. See the instructions at the end of the page.
motion_h.help4Txt1b: can be configured with up to 10 Include and/or Exclude windows.
motion_h.help6Txt1b: can be configured with up to 10 Include and/or Exclude windows.
motion_h.help8Txt1: Windows can be moved, resized, or disabled at any time. The behavior for each window is defined by adjusting the Object Size, History and Sensitivity profile sliders, as described below.
motion_h.help8Txt2: Motion detection windows are configured by group, by Include or Exclude windows. It is also possible to View All Windows in the group, or to View Selected Window, by selecting the appropriate radio button at the bottom of the configuration panel.
motion_h.help44Txt: Movement in a motion detection window can also be used to trigger Action Rules. See Action Rule Setup for more information.
motion_h.help47Txt: Note: Motion detection is available in Overview mode only.
motion_h.help9Txt: With reference to the motion detection parameters in the table below, follow these instructions to create a motion detection window. Note that the process is slightly different when using AMC than when using the Java applet as the default viewer.
motion_h.resTxt1: Choose a desired resolution for viewing while setting up Motion Detection from the View in drop-down list.
motion_h.stepTxta: a) For AMC: Check the radio button Configure Include Windows to set the type of window. Click the New button. A new window called DefaultWindow appears over the image. Select the name in the list of windows and rename the window.
motion_h.stepTxtb: b) For the Java applet: Click the Add Window button. Check the radio button Include or Exclude to define the type of window.
motion_h.movWinTxt: To move the window to the area to monitor, click on the text at the top of the window and drag it to the desired location. The window can be re-sized by dragging the bottom-right corner.
motion_h.slideTxt: Set the Object Size, History, and Sensitivity profile sliders for the window (applies only to Include windows). A full description of each profile slider is provided below. Click the Save button.
motion_h.resTxt2: To test the motion detection window, select it and then create some physical disturbance within the window area. Any detected motion is then indicated by colored peaks in the Activity Indicator. An alarm is only generated if the motion exceeds the tolerance defined by the black delimiter line and the peak turns red.
motion_h.resTxt3: For the Java applet: Click the Save button to save the new window.
motion_h.help10Txt: The parameters controlling the behavior of the motion detection window are described in the table below:
motion_h.help16Txt: Object size relative to region size.
motion_h.help20Txt: Only very large objects cause motion detection.
motion_h.help21Txt: At a high history level, an object that appears in the region will trigger motion detection for a long time before it is considered a non-moving part of the image.
motion_h.help22Txt: Ordinary colored objects on ordinary backgrounds will trigger motion detection.
motion_h.help26Txt: A large difference in luminance is required to trigger motion detection.
motion_h.help28Txt: Even very small objects trigger motion detection.
motion_h.help29Txt: At a low history level, an object that appears in the region will trigger motion detection for only a very short period. It will then be considered a non-moving object in the image.
motion_h.help30Txt: Only very bright objects on a dark background will trigger motion detection.
motion_h.help40Txt: To avoid triggering on small objects in the image, a high level can be selected. Set a low level to also trigger for small objects
motion_h.help41Txt: If no objects should appear in the region, a very high history level can be selected. This will cause motion detection to trigger as long as the object is present in the region.
motion_h.help42Txt: To only detect flashing light, select a low sensitivity. In other cases, a high sensitivity level is recommended.
motion_h.help43Txt: To configure an area in an Include window where detected motion will be ignored, create an Exclude window to mask the area within the Include window.
motion_h.help45Txt: The area within an Include window that has been masked by an Exclude window is marked by a rectangle of white dots. Other movement (outside the Include window) is automatically ignored.
motion_h.ExclResTxt: Choose a desired resolution for viewing while setting up Motion Detection from the View in drop-down list.
motion_h.stepAmcTxt: a) For AMC: Check the radio button Configure Exclude Windows to set the type of window. Click the New button. A new window called DefaultWindow appears over the image. Select the name in the list of windows and rename the window.
motion_h.stepJavAppTxt: b) For the Java applet: Click the Add Window button. A new window called DefaultWindow appears over the image. Check the radio button Exclude to define the type of window. Select the name in the list of windows and rename the window.
motion_h.ExclmovWinTxt: To move the window to the area to monitor, click on the text at the top of the window and drag it to the desired location. The window can be re-sized by dragging the bottom-right corner.
motion_h.SaveExclTxt: Click the Save button to save the new window.
motion_h.help46Txt: An Exclude window is named, sized and moved in the same way as an Include window, but no other configuration is necessary.
